vocabinfos.relatedNos: [{'strongNumber': 'H5119', 'matchingForm': 'נוֹחָה', 'stepTransliteration': 'no.chah', 'gloss': 'Nohah', '_searchResultRange': '1Chr.8.2@Gen.46.21-1Chr.8.2', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '挪哈', '_es_Gloss': 'Noha', '_zh_Gloss': '挪哈'}, {'strongNumber': 'H5283H', 'matchingForm': 'נַעֲמָן', 'stepTransliteration': 'na.a.man', 'gloss': 'Naaman', '_searchResultRange': 'Num.26.40-1Chr.8.4', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '乃縵', '_es_Gloss': 'Naamán', '_zh_Gloss': '乃缦'}, {'strongNumber': 'H5283I', 'matchingForm': 'נַעֲמָן', 'stepTransliteration': 'na.a.man', 'gloss': 'Naaman', '_searchResultRange': '2Kgs.5.1-27@2Kgs.5.1-Luke.4.27', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '乃縵', '_es_Gloss': 'Naamán', '_zh_Gloss': '乃缦'}, {'strongNumber': 'H5283J', 'matchingForm': 'נַעֲמָן', 'stepTransliteration': 'na.a.man', 'gloss': 'Naaman', '_searchResultRange': '1Chr.8.7', '_zh_tw_Gloss': '乃縵', '_es_Gloss': 'Naamán', '_zh_Gloss': '乃缦'}]
vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man of the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Gen.46.21;
son of: Benjamin (H1144);
brother of: Bela (H1106A), Becher (H1071), Ashbel (H0788), Gera (H1617), Ehi (H0278), Rosh (H7220), Muppim (H4649), Huppim (H2650H), Ard (H0714), Ahiram (H0297) and Jediael (H3043); also called Nohah at 1Ch.8.2;
Also named: no.chah (נוֹחָה "Nohah" H5119)
§ Naaman = "pleasantness"
1) son of Bela of the family of Benjamin; he was among the family of Jacob that went down to Egypt
2) commander-in-chief of the army of Syria; stricken with leprosy he went to Elisha, eventually followed his instructions, and was cured
vocabinfos._es_Definition: (a)   hijo de Bela; tribu de Benjamín; (b)   comandante del ejército del rey de Siria; (c)   hijo de Ehud; tribu de Benjamín
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
乃幔 这个陽性專有名詞 人名在原文的意思是 "愉快舒適"
1) 便雅憫支派的比拉的兒子; 是雅各家族中一同南遷至埃及的一支(創 46:21)
2) 敘利亞軍隊的元帥; 因受大痳瘋感染而求見以利沙, 終在遵著以利沙
的指示去做後得以痊癒
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
乃幔 这个阳性专有名词 人名在原文的意思是 "愉快舒适"
1) 便雅悯支派的比拉的儿子; 是雅各家族中一同南迁至埃及的一支(创 46:21)
2) 叙利亚军队的元帅; 因受大淋疯感染而求见以利沙, 终在遵着以利沙
的指示去做后得以痊愈

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man of the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.26.40;
son of: Bela (H1106A);
brother of: Ard (H0714H), Ezbon (H0675H), Uzzi (H5813I), Uzziel (H5816I), Jerimoth (H3406), Iri (H5901), Addar (H0146H), Gera (H1617I), Abihud (H0031), Abishua (H0050H) and Ahoah (H0265); also called Naamite at Num.26.40;
Also named: na.a.mi (נַעֲמִי "Naamite" H5280)
§ Naaman = "pleasantness"
1) son of Bela of the family of Benjamin; he was among the family of Jacob that went down to Egypt
2) commander-in-chief of the army of Syria; stricken with leprosy he went to Elisha, eventually followed his instructions, and was cured

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.5.1
Also named: Neeman, Naiman<\i> (Νεεμάν, Ναιμάν "Naaman" G3497)
§ Naaman = "pleasantness"
1) son of Bela of the family of Benjamin; he was among the family of Jacob that went down to Egypt
2) commander-in-chief of the army of Syria; stricken with leprosy he went to Elisha, eventually followed his instructions, and was cured

A man of the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Israel before the Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.7;
son of: Ehud (H0164);
brother of: Ahijah (H0281K), Gera (H1617J), Uzza (H5798H) and Ahihud (H0284)
§ Naaman = "pleasantness"
1) son of Bela of the family of Benjamin; he was among the family of Jacob that went down to Egypt
2) commander-in-chief of the army of Syria; stricken with leprosy he went to Elisha, eventually followed his instructions, and was cured
